On 21/10/05, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
> Just FYI,
>
> The RemoteTes=
tRunner in Eclipse does not keep old Test objects around to
> be re-run--wh=
en run in keepalive mode, it is still using the test class
> and String con=
structor argument to create a new Test object.  I'm not
> aware of any JUni=
t test runner that actually calls a test method on any
> test class instanc=
e twice: apparently an outgrowth of the
> one-object-per-test philosophy.  =
The win in keepalive mode is any
> Eclipse start-up time (for plug-in tests=
) and classloading time is
> passed up on the rerun.

Hmmm... I'll have to =

 no obvious way of determining the parameter
value (it doesn't match the te=
st's name property, nor do I invoke the
